contextId.information: The cries of the Israelites are spoken of as if they were a person and were able to travel up to where God is. AT: "God heard their pleas" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: their pleas went up to God

contextId.information: Here the word "shouts" are spoken of as if they were persons who are capable of moving on their own. AT: "I have heard the cries of the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: the shouts of the people of Israel have come to me

contextId.information: Here a "bribe" is described as if it were a person. AT: "bribe discredits ... undermines" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

Bezalel placed the statues of the cherubim as if they were real cherubim which were spreading their wings and overshadowing the atonement lid. AT: "They placed the winged creatures so that their wings touched each other and spread out over" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: The cherubim spread out their wings upward and overshadowed
